The Correct Way to Raise Your Website's Page Rank

Google is perhaps the most powerful search engines online today and why wouldn't it be? With more than 80% of web traffic generated from Google, it's hard to imagine a life without it. For website owners, though, the search engine means much more than it does to an average web surfer: it means the ranking of their websites. Getting your site ranked within the search engine's results is very important and one of the major factors involved is the rankings of your pages. Avoid Random Link Exchanges: An important factor in your page ranking is how many low quality backlinks you have--low quality backlinks can get your site downgraded by Google which makes it harder for your site to get ranked overall. This is exactly why you should avoid participating in any random link exchanges with other webmasters who want to increase their page rank as well. You need to focus your efforts on creating high quality one way backlinks instead of choosing the exchange.

Participate in Forums: The internet has a bunch of forums that are updated whenever members post new and/or relevant content. This is the reason that Google and the other search engines like these forums and getting them to give you backlinks really helps you raise the ranking of your site. It is important that, as you participate in forums like these, you include a link to your website within the signature file that shows up below all of your posts. Of course, you need to make sure that the forum you have targeted is actually related to your website and that it has a great page rank overall.

Use the Right Keywords: The sort of keywords that you insert into your content will play a major part in shaping up your website and grabbing the attention of Google. You need to use keyword phrases for which your target audience is actually searching. This gives Google a clear idea what your site is about, which will automatically improve your relationship with the search engine, giving you a better chance at improving your site's page rank.

Do not forget to offer a sitemap to your visitors that has links that point to the most important pages of your website because this is an important step of optimizing your site to Google's standards. Increasing your site's page rank is not a one day thing, it's something that takes time. Still if you persevere and practice some real patience you will see your page rank raised faster than you think.

Learn How You Can Make an Impact Via Blog Commenting

Effective blog commenting is one of the easiest ways to get relevant backlinks to your website or blog, and the at the same time drive quality traffic directly from the comments that you post. Of course, if you want to make sure that this strategy works for you, you need to remember a few things or else it could backfire and your efforts will prove futile. The largest hurdle that IMers and webmasters face when they take on blog commenting is finding the right blogs on which to comment and then getting those comments approved. This article will teach you a few of the strategies you can use to find success here.

Search for Fresh Posts: When you start blog commenting, you need to focus on posts that are freshly published because that would obviously increase your chances of getting your comment approved. When you start your search for comment-worthy blogs, you will see that there are all sorts of blogs with great content but haven't been updated in quite a while and are, for all intents and purposes, dormant or abandoned. You should try to stay away from blogs like these because it's not at all likely that the comments you leave will actually be approved. Instead, use the advanced search features in Google and specific blog search engines like Technorati to find blogs that have been recently updated, and then proceed with the commenting.

Search for DoFollow Blogs: The main reason you're doing commenting at all is because you want backlinks that matter. So if you want to give a boost to your SEO efforts, find DoFollow blogs that accept comments. It will take you some time to search out the DoFollow blogs but this is time well spent because DoFollow backlinks are actually counted by the search engines. So as an example, if you are commenting on the http://whatisagoodcreditscorenumber.com weblog, you need to see to it that the comment is relevant.

The Comment Must Be Directly Related to the Post: A major mistake that must be avoided when commenting is leaving comments that feel random or vague. If you look around you'll notice that spammers usually use this technique to post thousands of comments. So if you want to set yourself apart from everyone else, you need to make sure that your comment relates directly to the post on which it is placed. A comment that reads "nice post" doesn't cut it. "Enjoyed reading it" - as it may imply that you're just trying to get a comment out there without contributing anything to the blog.

Your traffic goals are not as important with blog commenting because here you're after quality, not quantity. After you figure out how to leverage your blog comments correctly, you will see that your efforts have been well worth it because overall, the links you build for yourself and the traffic those links bring in will be of top quality. This means that if you want to make things happen, now is the time to take action.
